messages.subject: Re: A great approach to world geography and history all rolled into one
messages.msgSnippet: What a unique way to learn about the world!  i ve heard about cooking recipes from that part of the world, dressing like they do, listening to their music.
messages.messageBody:
What a unique way to learn about the world! i've heard about cooking recipes from that part of the world, dressing like they do, listening to their music. But never hearing first-hand stories! Thanks for sharing!

Laurie

messages.subject: A great approach to world geography and history all rolled into one
messages.msgSnippet: This was in our local news... http://www.oregonlive.com/news/oregonian/margie_boule/index.ssf/2009/09/ sharing_stories_from_around_th.html
messages.messageBody:
This was in our local news...
http://www.oregonlive.com/news/oregonian/margie_boule/index.ssf/2009/09/\
sharing_stories_from_around_th.html
<http://www.oregonlive.com/news/oregonian/margie_boule/index.ssf/2009/09\
/sharing_stories_from_around_th.html>
I think it's a fabulous way to learn about the world, other than
traveling it! The cafe this woman owns is pretty spectacular too, with
really good desserts and an interesting dining experience. What I loved
about this article, is not just the content and approach to learning but
that they describe the woman as a "lover of life"... She should be an
unschooler!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
